meanings.definition: A high-ranking Christian cleric, typically in charge of a diocese and empowered to confer holy orders.
meanings.sent1: The bishops gathered to discuss important matters within the church.
meanings.sent2: The bishop led the congregation in prayer every Sunday.
meanings.sent3: The bishops had a friendly competition to see who could recite the most prayers.
meanings.sent4: She was the bishop of kindness, spreading love and compassion wherever she went.
meanings.sent5: The image of the bishop in his flowing robes was etched in their minds.

meanings.definition: A chess piece that can move any number of squares diagonally.
meanings.sent1: The bishops on the chessboard were strategically placed to protect the king.
meanings.sent2: Capturing the opponent's bishop was a crucial move in the game.
meanings.sent3: The bishops on the board seemed to be dancing as they moved diagonally.
meanings.sent4: Her strategy was like a bishop's move, unexpected but effective.
meanings.sent5: The bishop glided gracefully across the board, capturing pieces in its path.
